title: Easy Weeknight Dinners for Two
description: Get recipes and tips to make these easy weeknight dinners for two. They are ready in 40 minutes or less and use pantry staples.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE 21 Easy Weeknight Dinners for Two These simple recipes are ready in 40 minutes or less. By Vicky McDonald Vicky McDonald Vicky McDonald is a Seattle-based editor with over 15 years of experience in the media industry. She currently works as an editor for ParentMap.com. Prior to that, she was a senior content manager at Allrecipes. She loves baking, developing new recipes, and growing vegetables. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Updated on July 1, 2021 Close You know how it is—you get home from work, you're tired and hungry, and need something tasty and quick to cook for two. These simple recipes are all ready in 40 minutes or less, so you can spend more time relaxing after a long day instead of slaving over a stovetop. With options for beef, chicken, and veggies, you're sure to find a dinner for everyone to love. 01 of 22 Simple Lemon Herb Chicken View Recipe Save TTV78 Ready in 25 minutes: This simple pan-fried lemon and herb chicken breast is a tasty quick meal. Serve with some salad, or whatever vegetables you can forage from your fridge/freezer. 02 of 22 Baked Macaroni Cheese View Recipe Save Photo by ~*MyHotSouthernMess*~. Ready in 40 minutes: Comfort food at its best. This five-ingredient recipe is particularly easy to make. 03 of 22 Filet Mignon with Rich Balsamic Glaze View Recipe Save Ani Ready in 20 minutes: An impressive dinner for two, all you need is a side of potatoes and green beans to round out the plates. 04 of 22 Egg Curry View Recipe Save Photo by bd.weld. Ready in 35 minutes: Raid the spice drawer to make this simple Indian egg curry. 05 of 22 Chef John's BLT Pasta View Recipe Save Photo by Life Tastes Good. Ready in 40 minutes: Your favorite BLT favor combo, but with pasta. 06 of 22 Stir-Fry Chicken and Vegetables View Recipe Save naples34102 Ready in 40 minutes: This recipe does require a lot of different vegetables, but you easily use what you have and cut it down to one or two veggies. 07 of 22 Lo Mein Noodles View Recipe Save Photo by Sherri. Ready in 40 minutes: This noodle dish is hearty and delicious. Add some grilled chicken or beef to make it even more satisfying. 19 Dinner Ideas for Two 08 of 22 Quick and Easy Chicken Piquant View Recipe Save Ready in 25 minutes: If you're lucky enough to have pickles, capers, and chicken in the fridge, this tangy dinner could be yours. 09 of 22 Mexican Shakshuka View Recipe Save Allrecipes Ready in 30 minutes: Eggs save the day again in this Mexican-inspired dish. Serve with some bread or tortillas. 10 of 22 Spaghetti Aglio e Olio View Recipe Save Photo by Tara. Ready in 32 minutes: Some red pepper flakes, and a healthy dose of garlic make this pasta dish taste restaurant-quality. 11 of 22 Chana Masala (Savory Indian Chick Peas) View Recipe Save Photo by Christine Wooton. Ready in 30 minutes: A can of chickpeas is the primary protein in this super satisfying vegetarian curry. 12 of 22 Chicken with Lemon-Caper Sauce View Recipe Save Photo by Debi. Ready in 30 minutes: "This recipe is not only easy but does not require many items. I added a clove of garlic to the boiling wine sauce and used salted butter because I felt it needed more zing. I didn't measure the lemon. It was very simple and really good. Will go into my rotation," reviewer nskiddo21 says. 13 of 22 Salmon Fillets with Spinach for Two View Recipe Save Bibi Ready in 35 minutes: Here's a quick, healthy salmon dinner for two that's as easy as it is elegant. "Frozen spinach and garden vegetable cream cheese combine with salmon fillets!" says Bibi." This is easy to double, if you need 4 servings. Created for a regular oven, this recipe is easily prepared in an air fryer by reducing the temperature by 25 degrees and reducing the time by five minutes. Be sure to monitor for doneness, because overcooking will dry out the salmon." 14 of 22 Italian White Bean Chicken View Recipe Save SunnyByrd Ready in 40 minutes: Home cook Jacque Andrade Metzler added a pound of pasta to stretch the meal. "I think my husband went back for thirds," she says. "I didn't have fresh basil, so I used Italian seasoning instead. I also added a little salt to taste." 15 of 22 Pork Fried Rice View Recipe Save KGora Ready in 30 minutes: Reviewers consider this recipe an excellent use for leftovers, whether that's leftover pork chops, turkey (as a sub for pork), or rice. 16 of 22 Delicious Black Bean Burritos View Recipe Save CookinBug Ready in 25 minutes: This vegetarian-friendly dinner will be your new go-to when Tex-Mex is what you're craving. Serve with a side of Spanish rice. 17 of 22 Garlic Chicken Fried Brown Rice View Recipe Save Photo by Fit&Healthy Mom. Ready in 35 minutes: "Leftover brown rice is reborn in this chicken fried rice with peppers and onions. Black pepper, paprika, or dried parsley may be used to season after this is cooked," says recipe creator Joyce. 18 of 22 Pork Tenderloin Diablo View Recipe Save France C Ready in 40 minutes: "How can you go wrong with pork and mustard? This recipe just puts it over the top. One of our favorites, and part of the regular rotation," says reviewer aputler. 20 Desserts for Two That Are Perfect for Date Night 19 of 22 Chef John's Cashew Chicken View Recipe Save brittany_huddleston Ready in 30 minutes: "This is a fantastic way to use up some leftover grilled chicken breasts. This will work with any kind of cooked chicken, but leftover grilled chicken has that little bit of smokiness that adds something special to this quick recipe. Serve over hot cooked rice," Chef John says. 20 of 22 Bucatini All'Amatriciana View Recipe Save Buckwheat Queen Ready in 40 minutes: Make a stunning Italian dinner at home with this delicious pasta recipe. Salty pancetta, rich tomatoes, and tangy pecorino cheese combine for a world of flavors. 21 of 22 Spicy Thai Basil Chicken (Pad Krapow Gai) View Recipe Save dm11 Ready in 25 minutes: Featuring flavorful Thai ingredients like fish sauce, shallots, and green chiles, this chicken and rice dish is sure to become a household favorite. 22 of 22 More Recipes for Two Chef John Simple Skillet Dinners for Two Healthy Dinners for Two More Dinner Ideas for Two Explore more: Recipes Everyday Cooking Cooking for Two Was this page helpful? Thanks for your feedback! Tell us why!
